Students were meant to return to school (after the holiday) on 20 August but it has been postponed by 2 weeks due to a second wave of coronavirus. https://archive.fo/aQuRp

'Curfew to come into effect on Friday at 12 a.m.  In a press conference held this evening, the government of Aruba announced that on Friday at 12 a.m. a curfew will be in effect for the next two weeks between midnight and 5am.' https://archive.fo/gRgNp

The President Alberto Fernandez announced on Friday, August 14, that the lockdown in Argentina was extended until Aug. 30 restrictions meaning that restrictions in an around capital city Buenos Aires will continue. The measures, which are more relaxed in less densely populated areas, had been scheduled to expire on Sunday, August 16.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822183258/https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2020-08-14/argentina-sticks-with-covid-19-lockdown-focused-in-and-around-buenos-aires

"That, therefore, it is advisable to maintain the prohibition established by Decree No. 520/20, regarding certain activities and practices that are specifically stated and prohibited, some for the "DISPO" and others for the "ASPO", and, likewise, maintain among said prohibitions, as provided by Decree No. 641/20, the holding of social or family events in closed spaces and in all cases, even with less than TEN (10) PEOPLE, as indicated in articles 9 and 18 of this decree, with the scope and exceptions stipulated therein. In this sense, the Chief of the Cabinet of Ministers, at the request of the Governors or Governors, may authorize the holding of social or family gatherings in the places reached by the âDISPOâ measure, according to the epidemiological and sanitary risk assessment of the place. But in no case may it grant exceptions to said prohibition in the places reached by the ASPO." (Google translation of an excerpt of the last Presidencial order).    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822154552/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/233684/20200816?busqueda=3

"Limited public transportation within cities with strict limitations is operating. Intercity transport is mostly suspended.  Masks are required nationwide. Transport remains extremely restricted.  The Ministry of Transportation halted all Argentine intercity domestic buses, trains, and flights in March, and most of these services remain suspended due to the ongoing quarantine order.  In the Buenos Aires metropolitan area, only essential workers with a circulation permit may board public transportation. These regulations are likely to remain in place for the duration of the quarantine order."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822151447/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"The Government of Argentine has announced the extension of quarantine and social distancing measures.  The following areas will remain in quarantine (âaislamiento socialâ) through at least August 30: the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area; the Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, and San Pedro departments of Jujuy; the GÃ¼er Aike department of Santa Cruz; the RÃ­o Grande department of Tierra del Fuego; the Capital and Chamical departments of La Rioja; the General JosÃ© de San Martin department of Salta; and the Capital and Banda departments of Santiago del Estero.  Per the latest order, most of the rest of the country remains in mandatory social distancing.  Even in those provinces under mandatory social distancing, strict limits on travel, gatherings, and other activities apply."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822151447/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

Restrictions on intercity or interstate travel are still in place.   "The government of Argentina has implemented additional travel restrictions to limit the spread of COVID-19. Only travelers with confirmed international flight reservations may travel from the provinces to the Buenos Aires metro area 24 hours in advance of the flight.". In addition, "individual provinces may require additional local permits to enter or transit."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822151447/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Per the latest Argentine government policy, any foreigner who is not a resident in Argentina, will not be permitted to enter Argentina". Internal and international commercial flights were initially suspended until September 1, 2020, but it is likely these will be delayed.     Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822151447/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200822153914/https://www.flightglobal.com/networks/iata-warns-that-argentina-may-delay-september-air-travel-restart/139841.article
The national authorities only test symptomatic patients.      Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822151447/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

??The President Alberto FernÃ¡ndez announced, on social media, that the government  has decided to declare mobile telephony, internet services and pay TV public services in order to guarantee universal access to these services. The decree also extends the tariff freeze until December 31 (this tariff has been suspended since May due to the COVID-19 pandemic), and states that any future increase will be decided by the State.     Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822193347/https://www.web24.news/u/2020/08/argentina-freezes-cell-phone-internet-and-pay-tv-tariffs-and-regulates-future-increases.html  https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/233932/20200822 (Decree 690/2020 DECNU-2020-690-APN-PTE - Law N Â° 27.078. Modification in Spanish, unable to archieve)  http://web.archive.org/web/20200822194258/https://twitter.com/alferdez?lang=en (Presidentâs Twitter page)

On 14 August the Prime Minister announced that the State of Emergency for Belize would be extended to 28 days, from an initial 14. In the Ambergris Caye, and Orange Walk villages (Santa Martha; Shipyard and Guinea Grass), the state of emergency Statutory Instrument states that all non essential businesses are closed including all construction works, and Restaurants can open for delivery, take away or drive through only.    Source: UK Foreign Office, âForeign Travel Advice: Belizeâ (https://archive.vn/pbtrJ); Government of Belize Press Office, âStatutory Instrumentsâ (https://archive.vn/LGOO0)

On 14 August the Prime Minister announced that the State of Emergency for Belize would be extended to 28 days, from an initial 14. The state of emergency Statutory Instrument states that no competitive sporting events or recreational contact sports. Furthermore, church services or other services of worship are allowed.    Source: UK Foreign Office, âForeign Travel Advice: Belizeâ (https://archive.vn/pbtrJ); Government of Belize Press Office, âStatutory Instrumentsâ (https://archive.vn/LGOO0)

On 14 August the Prime Minister announced that the State of Emergency for Belize would be extended to 28 days, from an initial 14. The state of emergency Statutory Instrument enforces a curfew of 9pm to 5am every day. It states that gatherings of more than 10 persons are prohibited, that pubs, bars, nightclubs, discotheques, rum shops, casinos and gaming establishments are closed, and that no competitive sporting events or recreational contact sports. Furthermore, church services or other services of worship are not allowed.     Source: UK Foreign Office, âForeign Travel Advice: Belizeâ (https://archive.vn/pbtrJ); Government of Belize Press Office, âStatutory Instrumentsâ (https://archive.vn/LGOO0)

Public transport, public services and commercial companies will held accountable for ensuring customers adhere to the law.â    Source: UK Foreign Office, âForeign Travel Advice: Belizeâ (https://archive.vn/pbtrJ)

On 14 August the Prime Minister announced that the State of Emergency for Belize would be extended to 28 days, from an initial 14. The state of emergency Statutory Instrument enforces a curfew of 9pm to 5am every day. On 14 August the Prime Minister announced that the State of Emergency for Belize would be extended to 28 days, from an initial 14. The state of emergency Statutory Instrument enforces a curfew of 9pm to 5am every day. Curfew for unaccompanied minors from 6pm to 5am everyday unless accompanied by a parent or guardian. In the areas of Ambergris Caye and Orange Walk villages: Santa Martha; Shipyard and Guinea Grass, no person is allowed to enter or exit during the state of emergency.    Source: UK Foreign Office, âForeign Travel Advice: Belizeâ (https://archive.vn/pbtrJ); Government of Belize Press Office, âStatutory Instrumentsâ (https://archive.vn/LGOO0)

Entry to Belize is prohibited except for Belize nationals and permanent residents, and foreign diplomats accredited to Belize.     Source: UK Foreign Office, âForeign Travel Advice: Belizeâ (https://archive.vn/pbtrJ)

As a result of the curfew hours, only bus operators with a valid Road Service Permit to operate between the hours of 5:15am and 7:30pm and 5:15am to 9:30om, Sunday to Thursday and Friday and Saturday respectively will be allowed to operate.    Source: Government of Belize Press Office, "Ministry of Transport Addresses Public Transportation Reports"(http://archive.vn/V38Aj)

From 17 August, all National Sports Council Sporting Facilities countrywide are temporarily closed to the public until further notice.    Source: Government of Belize Press Office Facebook (http://archive.vn/kZ25M)

According to a press release published on 21 August, the Ministry of Education has announced that it will open schools for distance learning only. Preschool and primary schools will open on 7 September, and secondary schools will open on 5 October.    Source: Government of Belize Press Office Facebook page (http://archive.vn/p7jaB)

According to the US embassy website, the Bolivian government announced an extension of national quarantine measures through August 31, 2020, all scholastic activities remain suspended.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200824041522/https://bo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

According to the US embassy website, the Bolivian government announced an extension of national quarantine measures through August 31, 2020, classes and public events remain suspended.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200824041522/https://bo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Persons and vehicles are prohibited from circulating between the night time hours of 18:00 and 5:00 Monday to Friday. Vehicles are prohibited from circulating while people may circulate on foot within 500 meters of their home on Saturday and Sunday.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200824041522/https://bo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The Bolivian government determined this Friday, July 31, 2020, to extend a flexible quarantine until August 31, which implies that its land and air borders remain closed.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200824040951/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/bolivia-ampliacion-cuarentena-coronavirus-contagios.html

"The fiscal measures include temporary income support to vulnerable households (bringing forward the 13th pension payment to retirees, expanding the Bolsa Familia program with the inclusion of over 1 million more beneficiaries, cash transfers to informal and unemployed workers, and advance payments of salary bonuses to low income workers), employment support (partial compensation to workers which are temporarily suspended or have a cut in working hours, as well as temporary tax breaks and credit lines for firms that preserve employment), lower taxes and import levies on essential medical supplies, and new transfers from the federal to state governments to support higher health spending and as cushion against the expected fall in revenues."     http://web.archive.org/web/20200823153408/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

On 26 August, the Ministry of Education announced the plan for a staggered reopening of schools in the country. From 1 September, pilots to resume in-person teaching will begin in low-risk municipalities. In other areas of Colombia, however, schools are not expected to reopen until 2021.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827161841/https://www.eltiempo.com/vida/educacion/regreso-a-clase-reapertura-de-colegios-dependera-de-condiciones-sanitarias-de-regiones-533792

From 27 August, Bogota's rotated lockdown policy has finished and free mobility is allowed in the city. Smaller municipalities will remain under lockdown until 1 September, date when the national lockdown comes to an end.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827160644/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%201168%20DEL%2025%20DE%20AGOSTO%20DE%202020.pdf

Despite the new measures that will start on 1 September, any public or private events that lead to gatherings will remain restricted at the national level.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827160644/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%201168%20DEL%2025%20DE%20AGOSTO%20DE%202020.pdf

Despite the new measures that will start on 1 September, any public or private events that lead to gatherings will remain restricted at the national level.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827160644/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%201168%20DEL%2025%20DE%20AGOSTO%20DE%202020.pdf

From 27 August, Transmilenio (Bogota's main public transport system) has started operation at a 50% capacity. Transport in other major cities is expected to gradually resume from 1 September as a result of the new measures in the Decree 1168/2020.    https://archive.fo/ecDn5    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827160644/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%201168%20DEL%2025%20DE%20AGOSTO%20DE%202020.pdf

From 27 August, Bogota's rotated lockdown policy has been finished and free mobility is allowed in the city. Smaller municipalities will remain under more stringent lockdowns until 1 September, date when the national lockdown comes to an end.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827160644/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%201168%20DEL%2025%20DE%20AGOSTO%20DE%202020.pdf

From 1 September, most travel within Colombia will be resumed. This includes national commercial flights, which will resume operations in 13 airports across the country.    https://archive.fo/5vN7w    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827160644/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%201168%20DEL%2025%20DE%20AGOSTO%20DE%202020.pdf
As of 27 August, borders remain closed. There are expectations of some international routes being allowed in the country in September.    https://archive.fo/5vN7w
As of 27 August, the program "Ingreso Solidario" keeps transferring cash to 2.9 million beneficiaries in Colombia.    https://archive.fo/hUGns

From 1 August and during the next 9 days, there will be reopening of most economic activities in the country. These measures will be rollbacked from 10-21 August, where the country will go back to a lockdown; and will be reinstated from 22 August onwards, where this staggered reopening policy will be evaluated.    Businesses allowed to resume activities at a 50% capacity and from 5:00 am to 8:30 am include:    Markets, supermarkets, mini-supermarkets, grocery stores, bakeries, butchers, pharmacies, banking and financial services, laundries, hardware stores, locksmiths, sale of agricultural products, livestock, fisheries, florists, veterinary and hygiene supplies, funeral homes and vigil chapels.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200806161050/https://www.elmundo.cr/costa-rica/estas-son-las-nuevas-medidas-que-regiran-a-partir-del-1-de-agosto/

As mentioned before, certain sectors were opened, but this will fluctuate as some are going to close again for the subsequent 12 days in order to evaluate the process (it does not seem to be specified if this refers to essential ones remaining open only).    https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-costa-rica-economy/costa-rica-to-begin-staggered-reopening-as-july-coronavirus-cases-jump-idUKKCN24V07N

Airports opened for non-nationals on 7 August.  'Arrival protocols will be in place. Arriving passengers will have to complete an online questionnaire 24 hours before arrival, and have a PCR swab test with a negative result taken up to 72 hours before arrival. A thermal test and antibody blood test will be taken on arrival. If either test is positive, then a further PCR swab test will be carried out.    Mandatory 14 day quarantine will be necessary, self-isolating, in a Government facility, or in a certified hotel or guest house.'  https://web.archive.org/web/20200708080414/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/entry-requirements

Due to the extension of the curfew until 3 September that requires individuals to stay at home from 7/8pm until 5am the following morning, commercial establishments have been warned that if they violate the curfew, action would be taken without contemplation.    Source: http://archive.vn/hAb78

The government on 8 August that the past authoritiesâ curfew would remain, without any variation, until September 3 as part of the measures to stop the spread of the coronavirus in the country. They also noted that to ensure compliance of the compliance and the wearing of masks in public spaces, police and military surveillance will be enforced.     The curfew requires that people stay inside their homes from 7/8pm in the evenings until 5am the following morning. Furthermore, people will be required to stay home on Saturdays and Sundays from 5pm to 5am in some areas.     Source: http://archive.vn/0MTCv

"The Ministry of Business has started providing relief grants to small businesses experiencing challenges to sustain operations and retain employees and for training and development. "The Bank of Guyana (BoG) has urged commercial banks to consider reducing interest rates on loans and to allow for deferral of repayments to cushion the financial effects from COVID-19 on both individuals and businesses. The institution has granted a three-month moratorium to classify affected accounts as non-performing, and has waived on the regulatory treatment or condition for renegotiating loans under the supervisory guidelines."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200827174649/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Schools open August 10th, in order to complete the 2019-2020 academic year. Authorities in Mexico have extended the enforcement of the federal government's coronavirus disease (COVID-19) risk assessment scale until at least Aug. 23, with revisions to the classification of some states. For the period Aug. 17-23, six states will be under the red phase, while 24 states and Mexico City will be in the orange phase. Campeche will be the first state to move into the yellow phase, and there will still be no states at the green level.    http://archive.vn/UeeTN

Since May 29th, public transport has been operating daily, with additional biosecurity measures, including âmandatory use of masks in the public transport systemâ and a maximum of 30/ 34 passengers allowed on any one bus (depending on whether it is a blue, or orange, bus respectively). The first transfer is made today and the following on August 5, 6 and 7. #UnPanamÃ¡Mejorâ This includes ârecharges to those who have previously received their digital voucher: districts of ArraijÃ¡n, San Miguelito and ColÃ³n, Panamanians with suspended contracts, wallets, artists, trainers of the @InadehOficial, peddlers registered in @panamamunicipality.â Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200823152111/https://twitter.com/NitoCortizo/status/1290615980280946690?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1290615980280946690%7Ctwgr%5E&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fpanamapress.com.pa%2Frevisa-si-te-llego-inicia-el-pago-de-panama-solidario-anuncia-el-presidente-cortizo%2F âThe Digital Voucher is for an amount of B / .100, which the beneficiaries can cash with their personal identity card in supermarkets or pharmacies to buy food and medicineâ Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823151541/https://panamapress.com.pa/revisa-si-te-llego-inicia-el-pago-de-panama-solidario-anuncia-el-presidente-cortizo/

On August 19th, the Minister of Heath, Luis Francisco Sucre announced that, new opening measures will take effect from August 24th, but âthe prohibition of activities such as parties, family gatherings and others that involve crowds is maintained.Â Neither can social areas of the PHs be used at more than 25% of their capacity.Â PH pools and gyms cannot be used.â See Ministry of Health information website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823123131/https://www.yomeinformopma.org/info_detail/178

That is, they will be able to circulate all day, although it is recommended not to leave the house if not necessary.â See Ministry of Health information website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823130921/https://www.yomeinformopma.org/info_detail/180

Supreme Decree No. 139-2020-PCM, active as of August 12th, includes a âmandatory immobilization order:Â you will not be able to move on the street between 10:00 pm and 4:00 am from Monday to Sunday.Â Only in the departments and provincesÂ under targeted quarantineÂ , this measure runs from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 p.m. to 4:00 a.m. Also, immobilization is mandatory for all citizens nationwide throughout Sunday until 4:00 a.m. 00 am the next day.â Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200826215700/https://www.gob.pe/8895-coronavirus-apoyos-economicos-del-estado-por-el-aislamiento-social-obligatorio âMandatory social isolation:Â until August 31, citizens of theÂ departments and provinces indicatedÂ by Supreme Decree 139-2020-PCM may only leave home to provide or access essential goods services, and to carry out economic activities authorized at that time promulgation of said rule.Â In the other departments and provinces, only those under 14 years of age and people in risk groups should remain in quarantine.Â In all cases, the use of a mask is mandatory to circulate on public roads.â Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200826215700/https://www.gob.pe/8895-coronavirus-apoyos-economicos-del-estado-por-el-aislamiento-social-obligatorio

Key Policy Responses as of August 12th, as reported by the IMF are that the government âis granting flexibility to enterprises and households in the repayment of tax liabilitiesâ and that they âannounced a postponement of householdsâ payments of electricity and water and a subsidy for electricity payments of 800 million soles (0.1 percent of GDP)â Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200826224413/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  Also, government bonuses have been created to support households who meet specific means-tested requirements, including the âUniversal Family Bonus. The purpose of this bonus, which consists ofÂ S / 760,Â is to reach the 6.8 million households that do not have formal income and that have been affected by the measures adopted during the state of emergency.â Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200826222221/https://www.gob.pe/9022
The government is regularly updating their website and Twitter account (@pcmperu) with coronavirus information. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200826214603/https://www.gob.pe/coronavirus
No recent policy changes found on testing policy in Peru.
No recent policy changes found on contact tracing in Peru.

Effective from 10 August late-night to 23 August, 'all gyms and centers are closed until further notice. Contact sports are also not allowed. All private facilities such as casinos, gambling and entertainment including Suribet, bars, clubs, dance halls and brothels are closed'.    http://archive.vn/RrteH

Effective from 10 August late-night to 23 August, 'gatherings of more than 5 people, except for work or education, religious gatherings and funerals, are prohibited. For meetings for work or educational purposes, funerals and religious gatherings, a maximum number of 50 people in groups of 5 applies, subject to a distance of 1.5 meters'.    http://archive.vn/RrteH
President of Suriname, Chan Santokhi, extended the curfew from [9pm - 5am] to [8am - 5am], effective from 10 August late-night to 23 August.    http://archive.vn/RrteH

From 10 August 2020 to 5:00 a.m. on 11 October 2020, no more than a maximum number of twenty-five persons shall be allowed to be inside a religious place of worship at any given.   From 10 August 2020 to 5:00 a.m. on 11 October 2020, a maximum number of twenty-five persons may be permitted to attend a funeral service.  From 10 August 2020 to 5:00 a.m. on 31 August 2020â    no person shall host or attend any social activity of any description, including a wedding, of a gathering of more than ten persons on the islands of Providenciales, North Caicos and Parrot Cay; no person shall host or attend any social activity of any description, including a wedding, of a gathering of more than twenty-five persons on any of the other islands.   (Notice 82)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200813102956/https://www.gov.tc/moh/coronavirus/regulations

A curfew is imposed on the island of Providenciales, from 10:00 p.m. to 5:00 am. every night starting from 10 August 2020 until 5:00 a.m. on 31 August 2020; and  on the islands of North Caicos and Parrot Cay, from 8:00 p.m. to 5:00 am. every night starting from 10 August 2020 until 5:00 a.m. on 31 August 2020.    (2) Every person on the islands of Providenciales, North Caicos and Parrot Cay shall, during the curfew period under subregulation (1), remain confined to his place of residence (inclusive of the yard space) to avoid contact outside of their family, exceptâ  for essential travel to and from the doctor or hospital;  an attorney, for travel to and from a police station;  essential workers, who are directed to report to work  (Notice 82)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200813102956/https://www.gov.tc/moh/coronavirus/regulations

From 10 August 2020 to 5:00 a.m. on 31 August 2020, no person shall offer for hire or seek to travel on any interisland private or commercial air or sea transport that is non-essential, provided that an airline or a boat shall reduce the number of persons traveling on interisland transportation to permit physical distancing.  (Notice 82)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200813102956/https://www.gov.tc/moh/coronavirus/regulations

On 12 August, the National Institute of Civil Aeronautics (Inac) announced that the current restrictions on flight operations, including the ban on commercial flights, will be extended until 12 September. Domestic and international commercial flights are meant to progressively re-start from 13 September 2020 onwards.
